title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
npm - (00:03): it's kind of an old bug in a way: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-9  
flaviusolaru left at 00:09 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 00:12  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 01:33  
jvelociter left at 02:17 (Quit: jvelociter  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:22): npm: That is correct but since HQL has been assumed to be less dangerous than SQL, it has been considered an acceptable risk.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:25): Obviously non-parametrized queries are wrong but I think that was the reason for allowing searchDocuments.  
nickless left at 03:33 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
Denis left at 07:03 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
Denis joined #xwiki at 07:08  
plunden left #xwiki at 07:53  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:03  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:09  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 08:11  
Denis - (08:53): vmassol: Hi  
Denis - (08:53): I have filled up the form for the IDEA license has you know, and...  
vmassol - (08:53): Denis: hi  
Denis - (08:54): it seems that I have received a generic license for 1 year !  
Denis - (08:55): Type: Open Source License  
Denis - (08:55): Reference No\*: LC-23790-D328003561  
Denis - (08:55): Date of Issue: 23 April 2010  
Denis - (08:55): Expiration Date: 23 April 2011  
Denis - (08:55): Number of Authorized Users: not limited  
vmassol - (08:55): yes  
Denis - (08:56): does yours being personnal one ?  
vmassol - (08:59): hmm  
vmassol - (08:59): actually I made a mistake  
vmassol - (09:00): I mixed up with the profiler license  
vmassol - (09:00): the idea license is indeed for everyone  
vmassol - (09:00): good that you have renewed it though  
vmassol - (09:00): since ours expires in may 2010  
Denis - (09:00): so we had 2 of them now  ?  
Denis - (09:01): so we had a renew then :)  
vmassol - (09:01): however  
vmassol - (09:01): I don't think you should have pasted it here on a public channel  
Denis - (09:01): for sure :)  
Denis - (09:01): I was just about to ask you if there is a secure place for such information  
vmassol - (09:01): we might still need to renew it thoguh  
vmassol - (09:02): since I guess the username you've used is yours and not XWiki  
Denis - (09:02): no  
Denis - (09:02): it is XWiki  
Denis - (09:02): probably they thought we ask for the renew  
vmassol - (09:03): yep  
vmassol - (09:03): re private space we do'nt have this but it's easy to have a page only viewbale by the comitters group on xwiki.org  
vmassol - (09:11): Denis: ok I've created a page for our licenses: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentToolLicenses  
vmassol - (09:11): it's only viewable by the commmiter group  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:13  
evalica joined #xwiki at 09:15  
vmassol - (09:19): we should upgrade xwiki.org to 2.3 final when it's released IMO  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:19  
vmassol - (09:19): we should upgrade http://xwiki.org/ to 2.3 final when it's released IMO  
vmassol - (09:19): (repeating since thomas just entered ;))  
Denis - (09:19): it should be done ASAP, yes !  
Denis - (09:21): and what about fixing 2.2 and releasing 2.2.6 as well ?  
vmassol - (09:21): yes thomas mentioned it on the list yesterday  
Denis - (09:21): I could make the merge, but the release is still out of my reach  
vmassol - (09:21): what merge?  
vmassol - (09:21): it's already merged  
Denis - (09:22): do not have receive the commit ?  
vmassol - (09:22): (haven't checked the last fix from CalebJamesDeLisl though)  
Denis - (09:22): let me check svn...  
vmassol - (09:22): but what I mean is that 2.2.6 in general already contains some merge  
Denis - (09:23): yes but not the last one  
Denis - (09:23): do you want me to merge it ?  
vmassol - (09:23): the release is not out of your reach  
vmassol - (09:23): since we have a release process as I mentioned yesterday  
vmassol - (09:23): it's documented  
Denis - (09:23): yes but I need to be used to it  
vmassol - (09:23): yes  
vmassol - (09:23): but that means trying to do it :)  
Denis - (09:24): I know, I have even quickly read it already :)  
vmassol - (09:24): let's see what thoma think  
Denis - (09:24): but is it really time for a try ?  
vmassol - (09:24): either he wants to do it  
vmassol - (09:24): yes  
vmassol - (09:24): or you do it with our help  
gvallarelli joined #xwiki at 09:36  
gvallarelli - (09:36): 'morning  
Denis - (09:37): vmassol: selenium test seems to be pending, this probably why caleb has not merged already  
tmortagne - (09:38): vmassol, Denis: i'm ok with helping Denis to do the 2.2.6 if he wants to do it  
tmortagne - (09:43): [ANN]: Denis is 2.2.6 release manager  
vmassol - (09:45): cool, thanks denis  
Denis - (09:45): vmassol: I am not use to Hudson, why all jobs is pending on agent-1 and agent-2 does nothing ?  
vmassol - (09:46): agent-2 is reserved for our functional tests only I think  
vmassol - (09:46): ah no  
vmassol - (09:46): it'es the opposite  
vmassol - (09:46): I'll stop the build  
Denis - (09:46): ok, so it is very long, since the 2.3 test is not passed since caled commit  
Denis - (09:47): vmassol: should I create an account on hudson ?  
vmassol - (09:48): done  
vmassol - (09:48): Denis: if you want, but you won't need it for the release i think  
Denis - (09:49): if I do not need it, I dont  
Denis - (09:50): vmassol: it is the 2.3 branch we need to test  
Denis - (09:51): could you shedule that first ?  
Denis - (09:54): vmassol: finaly I have created an account to has a nicer name :)  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:03

mflorea left at 11:47 (Quit: Leaving.  
plunden joined #xwiki at 11:49  
vmassol - (11:52): jvdrean: have you started the release?  
vmassol - (11:52): when do you start ?  
jvdrean - (11:59): vmassol: there's 5 new tests failing, likely to be related to captcha, I've pinged CalebJamesDeLisl earlier  
jvdrean - (11:59): http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.3/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/20/testReport/  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:08  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 12:13  
jvelociter - (12:21): Hi all  
jvelociter - (12:21): has the release started yet ?  
sdumitriu - (12:22): CalebJamesDeLisl: Ping  
jvdrean - (12:23):  jvelociter: no  
jvelociter - (12:23): jvdrean: when do you plan to start it ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:23): good morning.  
vmassol - (12:23): now, once the tests pass  
jvelociter - (12:24): (I'd like to introducte a relatively safe improvment to the REST api if I have time enough, to allow to precise the "replyto" field when adding a comment)  
sdumitriu - (12:24): Caleb, how do I enable Captcha for guest comments?  
jvelociter - (12:24): ok, so maybe for 2.3.1 then  
vmassol - (12:24): yes better jvelociter  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:24): Rights management for wiki or space. Checkbox at the bottom.  
sdumitriu - (12:24): K, thanks  
sdumitriu - (12:25): It's not there, do I need to import something special?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:26): Hmm, it was there yesterday!  
sdumitriu - (12:26): I'm checking on myxwiki, 2.3-RC-1  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:26): jvdrean: I see your ping, running these tests.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:28): I meant to watch it complete on hudson but it hung and I didn't want to stay up to watch my slow computer complete the tests.  
jvdrean1 joined #xwiki at 12:37  
jvdrean left at 12:38 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 12:44  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 13:00  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:03): Not sure what to make of this. No livetable in the tests but it's there in the installation (both for postgres and hsql)  
vmassol left at 13:03 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
nickless joined #xwiki at 13:05  
jvelociter - (13:12): Guys, in fact if no one strongly oppose and with a review from Fabio, I'd like to have the REST patch I mentionned earlier in 2.3  
jvelociter - (13:12): It's available at http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5134  
jvelociter - (13:12): let me know what you think.  
sdumitriu - (13:12): jvelociter: comment.setReplyTo(httpServletRequest.getParameter(COMMENT\_REPLYTO\_FIELD\_NAME));  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Will this work well if the replyTo is not present in the request?  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Probably yes, the check is actually when the comment is created, in CommentResource  
jvelociter - (13:14): sdumitriu: yes it's neutral if not present  
sdumitriu - (13:14): +    private static final String COMMENT\_REPLYTO\_FIELD\_NAME = "replyto";  
sdumitriu - (13:14): +          <element name="replyTo" type="string"></element>  
sdumitriu - (13:14): Is it case insensitive?  
jvelociter - (13:14): they are 2 different things  
jvelociter - (13:15): the one in the XSD is used to generate model classes  
jvelociter - (13:15): (to have comment.setReplyTo and not comment.setReplyto)  
sdumitriu - (13:15): (I don't know much about how xwiki-rest works, just guessing)  
jvelociter - (13:16): but better have the same, indeed  
jvelociter - (13:16): let me change that  
sdumitriu - (13:16): But +1 for applying it on 2.3  
jvelociter - (13:17): I've made it     private static final String COMMENT\_REPLYTO\_FIELD\_NAME = "replyTo";  
jvelociter - (13:17): ok  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 13:30  
florinciu left at 13:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 13:33  
flaviusolaru left at 13:34 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
fmancinelli - (13:37): Re http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5134, I think it's fine.  
jvelociter - (13:38): vmassol1: tmortagne jvdrean1 anything against ?  
fmancinelli - (13:40): Maybe in the future we should think about API versioning... Something like binding the RESTful API URIs to v1/... v2/... etc.  
fmancinelli - (13:40): It's alway the same problem with changing APIs. This applies to REST as well  
jvdrean1 - (13:42): jvelociter: +0  
jvelociter - (13:42): fmancinelli: I'm going to comment it with "since 2.3"  
jvelociter - (13:43): but that would be an idea to discus  
tmortagne - (13:43): jvelociter: +0  
sdumitriu - (13:46): fmancinelli: This is an optional addition, it's not mandatory, so no APIs break; thus, we don't need to create a new version  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 13:47  
fmancinelli - (13:47): sdumitriu: Yes. Actually I was talking in general... eventually we will break the API :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:50): Just reverted 4755 patch, still no livetable in tests. Maybe tmortagne should look at it?  
vmassol1 - (13:51): jvelociter: +0 provided it's not pushing back the release  
vmassol1 is now known as vmassol ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
tmortagne - (13:53): CalebJamesDeLisl: did not looked what you are talking about but i will certainly not have time to look at anything today  
tmortagne - (13:53): have to go now  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:53): Ok. I'm reverting your patches from yesterday to test again.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (13:53): (locally)  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:58  
Denis - (14:13): CalebJamesDeLisl: I am about to commit the merge of your changes for 4755 onto 2.2 branche, anything against ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:14): Go ahead, I was going to do that myself, also I didn't get the trunk yet (went backwards this time).  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:14): I'm trying to hunt down the source of this missing livetable  
sdumitriu - (14:14): RT @alexanderhanff  preparing a criminal complaint against Canonical over privacy concerns  raised by logging/publishing of online chatrooms  
sdumitriu - (14:15): I don't see the problem with publishing IRC logs, as long as we mention this. WDYT?  
lucaa - (14:16): +1. Is there a way to put a longer welcome message where to tell them that if they don't agree they should get out et all?  
sdumitriu - (14:17): I don't that's needed, it's their choice to stay  
sdumitriu - (14:17): We did mention it's logged, it's their problem if they don't understand what that means  
lucaa - (14:17): yes, but we need to make sure they know it. However, it;s also written at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/IRC that it's logged and public so they should read stuff carefully  
lucaa - (14:18): (like, make sure there is a way to know that it's logged before you actually join it -- logging your join can be a privacy issue too)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:19): Hahahaha... If it's an issue I'll log the chat. In USA the test is "reasonable expectation of privacy" I don't expect this guy's argument will hold water though.  
fmancinelli - (14:27): lucaa: Actually a join "welcome message" with the warning should be enough I think.  
lucaa - (14:27): (the chat topic says it's logged, which works as a welcome message, so it could be enough)  
fmancinelli - (14:29): lucaa: Yes, but it might be hidden if the window is not too large, or simply overlooked. A direct, private message sent to the user each time she joins the channel would solve any problem  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:31): The most important question IMO is "is what we do wrong?" If we are doing what we believe to be right and lawful then we get a protection under the doctrine of "color of right".  
fmancinelli - (14:46): CalebJamesDeLisl: Maybe nothing, but since segiu raised the question... I think that being more explicit on the logging policy with a direct message doesn't cost anything and, imho, it's a better way to communicate this policy than using a chat topic or some disclaimer in a wiki document on the web.  
Ciprian joined #xwiki at 14:48  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:48): If you want to change it because you think it should be clearer, I see no problem with that but if you are afraid of somebody hacking the law and using it to attack us then I don't think there is anything which is enough to satisfy them.  
fmancinelli - (14:48): CalebJamesDeLisl: At least you can make it harder for him :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:49): eg: if we make if a welcome message, they may argue that they forget and need reminders.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:50): Give them reminders and they argue that they should have a popup asking them if they really want to post since it's logged. It never ends.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:56): I say do what you believe is right even if you are the only one. You will feel good about yourself and if a litigious person wishes to complain you are in a good situation. see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color\_%28law%29  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:57): That is just one man's opinion ;)  
kibahop left #xwiki at 15:08  
florinciu left at 15:31 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:39  
mflorea - (15:40): vmassol: what's the easiest way to get document/attachment reference when I have the wiki, space, page, fileName parts?  
mflorea - (15:40): get=create a doc/attachment reference object  
jvelociter - (15:41): Is is just me or we have an issue with SVN ?  
jvelociter - (15:41): Jerome-Velociters-iMac:trunks jvelociter$ svn up  
jvelociter - (15:41): svn: OPTIONS of 'https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/trunks': could not connect to server (https://svn.xwiki.org)  
jvelociter - (15:42): (though I can browse the SVN from web)  
jvelociter - (15:42): ah wait  
jvelociter - (15:42): it's probably just me :)  
jvdrean1 - (15:51): jvelociter: have you added/removed containers for the livetable lately ?  
jvelociter - (15:51): not since the last one we've talked  
jvelociter - (15:52): is there an issue ?  
jvdrean1 - (15:52): ok, no modification since the discussion with Denis about filters ?  
jvelociter - (15:52): modifications yes, but no container changes  
jvelociter - (15:52): is there an issue with the livetable ?  
jvdrean1 - (15:53): jvelociter: func tests doesn't seem to find the livetable anymore, CalebJamesDeLisl should be able to tell you more about this  
jvelociter - (15:53): maybe I can help, I'm done with the REST commit now  
jvelociter - (15:53): which test is failing CalebJamesDeLisl ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:54): 6 tests. It waits forever and shows no table. Testing now with 28540 reverted.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:54): Failing tests are in CommentTest  
jvelociter - (15:55): ok. it's selenium1 test ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:56): Yes. Strange thing is it works in practice with postgres and hsql. Just not in test.  
plunden left #xwiki at 15:56  
jvdrean1 - (15:57): CalebJamesDeLisl: you tried the jetty+hsqld distrib from tests target/ dir >  
jvdrean1 - (15:57): ?  
jvelociter - (15:57): CalebJamesDeLisl: have you tried to run it in debug mode ?  
jvelociter - (15:57): to see what happen ?  
jvelociter - (15:57): (just building 2.3 XE now)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:58): jvdrean1: No I have been testing from distribution-test/selenium-tests/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): I havn't tried debug mode, can I pass it as a parameter to jetty?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): Removing r28540 has fixed the tests.  
jvdrean1 - (15:59): yes but did you try distribution-test/selenium-tests/target/xwiki-enterprise-\*/start\_xwiki.sh manually to see if you were able to reproduce ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:00): I have not. First I have to rebuild web...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:02): hmm must remember this start\_xwiki.sh. I have only been playing with tests by hanging selenium with a sleep statement inside an infinite loop ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:04): while(2!=3){try{Thread.sleep(10000);}catch(Exception e){}}  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:05): Nice trick because you can stop the test in a particular state.  
jvelociter - (16:05): ok it seens to timeout on the right editor  
jvelociter - (16:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: jvdrean1 the issue is real, not only in selenium tests  
jvelociter - (16:08): there's a JS error when displaying the right editor on a page  
jvelociter - (16:08): I'll handle it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:10): Anyone know why jobs are bound to hudson slaves? This might have been caught earlier if these tests had run faster.  
jvelociter - (16:14): my bad for the right editor issue. It was a typo in my last refactoring :(  
jvdrean1 - (16:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: we did this to avoid bottlenecks, if the jobs were not tied we'd often have tests executing on both agents (which means no module builds for approx 1h)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:17): I see. Of course the other problem is that when a build hangs, the other builds stop until someone with enough privilege sees it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:18): "typo in my last refactoring" my most common mistake I think.  
jvelociter - (16:18): :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:19): "oops I'll just change this, commit, done."  
jvdrean1 - (16:19): CalebJamesDeLisl: well we'd probably end up with builds hang on all the agents :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:20): Maybe so. When I get a bigger computer I might be able to volunteer it to do builds. Another agent would speed things up.  
vmassol - (16:21): I thought we had added a windows agent too, is it not working?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:21): Maybe the "same build running twice" issue has been or will be fixed by the hudson people.  
Ciprian left #xwiki at 16:22  
jvelociter - (16:23): I've reopened http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5130. I have a fix for it, I'm building XE and running the comment tests before I commit it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:23): I see the windows box there but the only machine working is agent-2, the others are idle. It was the same situation last night and there was a huge build queue.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:26): Denis: Double check your @since number in r28560.  
jvelociter - (16:34): closed XWIKI-5130 again, tests pass locally

CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:14): Not sure how this is done but that's my guess.

vmassol - (18:35): guys can you see the stats on this page: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists ?  
sdumitriu - (18:35): No  
vmassol - (18:36): sdumitriu: yeah it's not going to work on links :)  
sdumitriu - (18:36): Hehe  
sdumitriu - (18:36): No, actually I tried with JS and Flash active  
sdumitriu - (18:36): Because I imagined it won't work  
vmassol - (18:37): it works for me fine on FF + mac but gregory who's also on FF + mac says he doesn't see the graphs  
jvdrean1 left at 18:56 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (18:57): so nobody can see the graphs?  
sdumitriu - (19:01): I can't  
sdumitriu - (19:04): Who keeps changing that scheduler?  
vmassol - (19:08): sdumitriu: it uses an HTML <object> tag  
vmassol - (19:08): and swf  
tmortagne - (19:08): vmassol: i can't see any graph either  
vmassol - (19:08): you have flash in your browser?  
tmortagne - (19:08): yes  
vmassol - (19:09): hmm I wonder why I can see it :)  
tmortagne - (19:09): i can see video on youtube at least  
tmortagne - (19:09): checking if nothing is not doing somehting weird  
tmortagne - (19:09): s/nothing/noscript/  
tmortagne - (19:12): vmassol: there is something wrong in your html  
tmortagne - (19:12): <object type="application/x-shockwave-flash" data="http://markmail.org/swf/bar\_1204073351.swf" width="250 height="130"> there is a " missing after 250  
vmassol - (19:12): ah right I was on chrome  
vmassol - (19:12): fixing that  
tmortagne - (19:13): maybe that's why  
vmassol - (19:13): is it better now?  
vmassol - (19:13): works for me on FF and chrome  
vmassol - (19:13): thanks thomas for catching this  
tmortagne - (19:14): yep working now  
tmortagne - (19:14): vmassol: i forgot to disable html validator so i looked at it since it was saying there was an error ;)  
vmassol - (19:14): hehe  
tmortagne - (19:16): it was working without the fix on opera  
vmassol - (19:16): yes chrome and opera fixes it it seems  
vmassol - (19:16): (chrome, safari and other webkit based browsers)
